version.description: The schema version that this post object adheres to.

id.description: The post ID. It must be a positive integer.

slug.description: The URL slug that refers to this post.

author.description: The user ID of the author of this post.

type.description: The post type: 'post', 'page', and 'attachment' are valid post types on any WordPress site, other post types may require a corresponding plugin to import correctly.

postStatus.description: The publication status of the post. Will almost certainly be one of 'publish', 'pending', 'draft', 'auto-draft', 'future', 'private', 'inherit', or 'trash'.

published.description: The timestamp of when this post was published, in UTC.

modified.description: The timestamp of when this post was last modified, in UTC.

terms.description: An array of term IDs that apply to this post.

parent.description: The post ID of this post's parent, or 0 if it doesn't have a parent.

password.description: The password for this post. Note that this password is not used in a cryptographically secure manner, and will be stored in plain text.

menuOrder.description: An ordering value to determine where in an auto-generated menu this post will appear in relation to its siblings.

sticky.description: Whether this post should 'stick' to the top of the post list.

commentsOpen.description: Flag whether or not comments are open on this post.

pingsOpen.description: Flag whether or not this post accepts pingbacks.

attachmentUrl.description: When the post type is an attachment, this must be set to the URL of where the attachment file can be found.

content.description: The content of the post. It can be stored as a string (eg, of HTML), or as an array of block objects.

excerpt.description: The excerpt of the post. It can be stored as a string (eg, of HTML), or as an array of block objects.
